text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The government and workers' union reached a draft accord to raise salaries and avoid laying off workers in the state service.
- Algeria's oil and gas exports valued at about $12.5 billion in 1996.
- Security forces kill seven "terrorists" in Algiers.
- The government will stop importing cement next July.

- Several French ministers and businessmen to visit Algiers soon. Prime Minister Alain Juppe will pay an official visit to Algiers before the Algerian parliamentary elections to be held in May or June.
- The govenment considers a new family law banning polygamy.
